title: Apply for the EDUFI -internship at FIME
content:
FIME is looking for a university intern to Beirut for autumn 2026 through the Finnish National Board of Education’s EDUFI application.

An internship at FIME offers an interesting perspective on the work of a research institute in the Middle East. The intern will support the institute’s operations by assisting with a diverse set of tasks including: active participation in organizing the institute’s events and courses, and in the practical implementation of the institute’s communications. In terms of communications, the institute’s website and social media channels (Instagram, Facebook) in particular are part of the intern’s focus areas. title: Juha Mäkelä Appointed Director of the Finnish Institute in the Middle East
content:
Juha Mäkelä, a General Staff officer and Doctor of Military Sciences, has been appointed as the next Director of the Finnish Institute in the Middle East (FIME). He has 20 years of experience in research on Middle Eastern security and foreign policy. Mäkelä has previously served, among other roles, as a visiting researcher at the Al-Ahram Center for Political and Strategic Studies in Cairo, as well as a defence attaché in Turkey and Lebanon.

Mäkelä will retire from his position as an officer in the spring and will assume his new post in Beirut on 1 June 2026. He has been involved in the activities of the Finnish Institute in the Middle East for nearly twenty years and has participated in courses organized by the institute. title: FIME is recruiting a researcher
content:
The Finnish Institute in the Middle East (FIME) is recruiting a doctoral or postdoctoral researcher for a fixed term of 1.5.2026–30.4.2028 (2 years). The position is located at the Institute in Beirut, Lebanon.

The Finnish Institute in the Middle East is an academic institute that focuses on the study of Middle East in contemporary and classical periods within a variety of disciplines in humanities, social sciences, law, theology and education. The Institute supports Finnish research on the Middle East and offers teaching in cooperation with universities. The institute also brings research-based perspectives to public discussions on the Middle East. title: Öppen webbkurs ”En missförstådd religion? Lär känna grunderna i islam” finns nu på svenska
content:
FIME:s öppna onlinekurs ”En missförstådd religion? Lär känna grunderna i islam” har nu publicerats på svenska. Den kostnadsfria webbkursen är tillgänglig för alla som vill lära sig mer om islam. Du kan börja kursen genast på lahi-itakurssit.fi/course/grunderna-i-islam.

Är sharia, sura och jihad bekanta begrepp för dig? Vill du veta mer om vad dessa och andra grundläggande islamiska begrepp betyder? I den här kursen får du den viktigaste informationen om islam och lär dig att tillämpa kunskapen på aktuella samhällsfrågor. Ämnet behandlas i ljuset av akademisk forskning.

Kursen är gratis och kräver inga förkunskaper. Du kan börja när det passar dig.
creator: Laura Aho

title: The institute’s spring intern started her work in Beirut
content:
FIME’s spring 2026 intern, Venla Lehtinen, has started her work in Beirut.

Venla is a master’s student in Global Politics and Theology at the University of Helsinki. She holds bachelor’s degrees in Social Science and Theology. In her studies, she has focused on peace and conflict studies as well as the cultures, religions, and politics of the MENA region and the Horn of Africa. During the spring, she will be working on her master’s thesis examining sexual violence in conflicts and crisis situations. Her research focuses on the international community’s efforts to address sexual violence in refugee camps in Lebanon.

title: Apply for FIMEs Research Residency by 15.2.2026
content: The research residency program of the Finnish Institute in the Middle East is intended for research-related stays at universities and other research institutes in the Middle East. The grant recipient may use the grant to cover travel expenses, accommodation, and all other research-related and living expenses during the residency. The grant for the first month is 1600 € and for the other months 1000 €. The grant must be used during the year 2026. The receiving university or institute can be located in any country or area covered by the operations of the Finnish Institute in the Middle East and its Foundation. title: Call for applications: FIME foundation’s grants for 2026
content: The Foundation of the Finnish Institute in the Middle East’s grant application period is open 14.1. –15.2.2026. You can apply for travel grants for postgraduate studies, research and research trips, as well as grants for Arabic language courses. Travel grants are awarded for research and research-related trips in the Middle East, and Arabic grants are awarded for at least one month of Arabic language study in the Middle East. In addition, you can apply for Friends of the Finnish Institute in the Middle East’s pro gradu stipend, which awarded by the aforementioned association, and Aimo T. title: Arabic Language Café continues at Oodi
content:
Are you studying Arabic at university or are you otherwise interested in the Arabic language and culture? Welcome to the Arabic language café, organized in cooperation with the Finnish Institute for the Middle East, Middle East Students (LiO) and the Oodi Central Library.

The language café starts on Thursday, January 8 and meets on Thursdays from 5:15 PM to 6:45 PM in Oodi (group room 4). Participation is free and open to anyone interested in Arabic.

The Language Café is an informal, yet guided and encouraging opportunity to practice Arabic, discuss various themes, and meet both other Arabic learners and native Arabic speakers. Each meeting is led by two instructors, and also includes visitors Arabs or interested in Arabic.
